page.title: 17Language
page.content: One topic which often causes problems in the area is language.Both Welsh and English are used in everyday life by many people although English is the main language in Bangor.In Gwynedd as a whole,however,63% of the population can speak Welsh. The County Council has adopted a bilingual policy which extends most extensively into its schools.Of the 7 primary schools in the city 5 are bilingual,1 is a Welsh medium school and 1(the Catholic school) has very little Welsh taught there.Of the 2 secondary schools one is a Welsh medium school,Ysgol Tryfan,whilst the other,Friars School,is bilingual but with the emphasis on English medium teaching. Most of the commercial life of the area is conducted in English.
